summary: An email from Reed Brodsky to Stephanie Brooker discussing Honeycomb Asset Management holding funds for entities linked to Jeffrey Epstein and Richard Khan. The email seeks guidance on ensuring access to funds and the legal options for holding them, noting forced redemptions and beneficiary details.

events.title: Email regarding Epstein-linked funds
events.description: Reed Brodsky emails Stephanie Brooker seeking guidance on Honeycomb Asset Management holding funds for entities linked to Jeffrey Epstein and Richard Khan, discussing forced redemptions and legal options.

keyFacts: Honeycomb Asset Management is holding approximately $70 million in liquid funds for the benefit of Southern Trust, and $1 million for Richard Khan and his spouse, all linked to Jeffrey Epstein.
A 2013 Butterfly Trust, with beneficiaries including Richard Khan, lndyk, and Ghislaine Maxwell, is noted as an illiquid asset whose value depends on a future public offering.
Honeycomb Asset Management has forced the liquidation of investments, requiring entities like Southern Trust to redeem funds, prompting legal inquiries about holding the money.
The correspondence seeks legal guidance on whether funds linked to Epstein and Khan can be retained through court order or other means, indicating post-arrest financial scrutiny.
